bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CLAY:H.R. 5067.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Commerce Clause Article I, Section 8,[Page H6107]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text: Requires the Director of the Federal Insurance Office (in the Department of the Treasury) to study whether the insurance industry engages in the illegal practices of insurance steering or redlining, including an investigation of insurance products, pricing, promotions, and placement of services being offered to consumers in the United States.

bill.title: To require the Federal Insurance Office to carry out a study on illegal steering and redlining in the insurance industry.

item.title: To require the Federal Insurance Office to carry out a study on illegal steering and redlining in the insurance industry.
To require the Federal Insurance Office to carry out a study on illegal steering and redlining in the insurance industry.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
